definition: lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/between laughter and tears
to cry/to weep aloud/to crow/to hoot
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: HanShan looked at hanging in a row, courts, funny clothes at a loss for words.
sentences.chinese: 韓珊看着掛在院中的一排衣服，啼笑皆非，無話可說。

sentences.english: Poetry specialised , at that moment , in the wry chronicling of the everyday.
sentences.chinese: 當時，入詩的皆爲日常瑣事，令人啼笑皆非。

definition: lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/both funny and extremely embarrassing/between laughter and tears
cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
to be unable to make any sense of the matter/to be at a loss
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
comical/funny/amusing/old pr. [gu3 ji1]/huaji, a form of comedy performance popular in Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang
